event.name: START_BEACON_BOSS
event.text: The Pilgrim home fleet and the massive ship that carries the Pilgrim Council are just a few jumps away from here. Get there quickly.

event.name: FEDERATION_BASE
event.text: You arrive at the heart of the last Pilgrim fleet - all the other fleets have long since been crushed. After confirming your identity and mission, you are immediately conveyed to the Council, to whom you present the sealed envelope.

The Sophon are attempting to broker a ceasefire between the Pilgrims and the United Empire. You had no idea that the United Empire had agreed to this; the Council must have been in back-channel talks with Sophon for some time now. The social party in the Empire legislature has finally managed to force a vote on the issue of secession, and they stand a solid chance at winning.

Negotiations are surprisingly quick through a Sophon proxy. All hostilities will cease galaxy-wide for a period of 2 months, until the vote has been made, starting at 0500 hours the next morning. Until that time, no new offensive actions shall be conducted.

A great load suddenly lifts from your shoulders. You figure you can take your time to refuel and repair the ship, get some R and R, maybe follow up on that one Sophon captain - but before you can finish the thought, warning klaxons sound.

choice.text: An attack!? That's not very sporting.

event.text: An entire UE expeditionary fleet has exited from FTL a few jumps away - the premier fighting unit in the galaxy. Frigates and destroyers surrounding a well-armed command and control ship. You sprint to your ship. Survive.

event.name: BOSS_AUTOMATED
event.text: Leaking air and littered with bodies, you are stunned that the Mahan is still fighting as hard as ever. You have the mental image of its Admiral standing alone at the conn, shaking his fist at the devil, but have no way of knowing if that's the truth.

event.name: BOSS_DESTROYED
event.text: The UES Mahan shudders, as if shaken by a giant, and after a flash of light she's gone. The battle will rage for hours yet, but this Empire fleet is beaten. As for the Pilgrims...only time will tell.
event.unlockShip: An advanced Pilgrim destroyer has been unlocked and can be found in the hangar!

event.text: Thanks for playing Sonata 7! - Matt Alioto

event.name: BOSS_ESCAPED
event.text: After one last devastating barrage from your ship, one of Mahan's escorts are torn apart by multiple internal explosions. As you veer away to avoid them, the Mahan manages to jump away. Without one of its escorts, it will have to get closer to the base to be a threat. You've bought some time, but you've got to keep up the assault!

event.name: BOSS_TEXT_1
event.text: There she is, the UES Mahan - all 350,000 tons of her. It's the Admiral's flagship, and if he goes down you might have a chance. A destroyer and a frigate are guarding the Mahan, and it's just been re-armed with an experimental tachyon accelerator. This won't be easy. "Hell," you gulp and think to yourself, "this won't be anything except suicidal."

event.name: BOSS_TEXT_2
event.text: One destroyer down. They weren't able to destroy you with direct firepower before, so they're likely to try drones.

event.name: BOSS_TEXT_3
event.text: All right, this is it. Just you and the big boy. The Mahan has chosen low orbit of a Pilgrim planet for the final showdown. The Admiral is likely going to deploy the tachyon accelerator now. Lights sparkle on the planet below you. Kill him.

textList.name: BOSS_REPAIR_STATION
textList.text: There is a a mobile ship construction platform stationed at this beacon. After a brief exchange they give you clearance to receive emergency repairs and military supplies.
An IHTG ship-yard has been converted into a military refueling station. They offer you the chance to patch up your ship and refresh some supplies.
Chatter on the comm suggests the nearby Pilgrim base is outfitted with a repair station. When you forward your mission priority they quickly help repair your ship and give you some supplies.
A forward construction station is in the process of repairing damaged war ships. Your command codes convince them to do a quick patch job on your ship.
A trade station was abandoned nearby. Some Pilgrims engineers re-purposed their shipyard to perform military repairs. They offer to help fix your ship.

textList.name: BOSS_SCOUT
textList.text: This sector is controlled by the Pilgrims, but an enemy scout has somehow slipped behind the lines. It is happily blowing the crap out of undefended supply dumps and repair stations; you should stop it before it causes any more havoc.
Long range scanners show this system is devoid of capital ships; clearly it is not of strategic value. Wait...you detect an EM burst. A loyalist ship has jumped into the system!
Sensors indicate that the Empire is setting up a forward Jump Beacon behind the nearby planet's moon. More importantly, a number of ships are passing by; prepare for a fight!

Pilgrim ships are scarce in this region of space despite a number of civilian space stations. You see a small bomber squadron desperately fighting off a swarm of loyalist attackers and move in to assist.
As soon as you arrive at the beacon, a loyalist scout turns to engage. Power up the weapons!
Your scans reveal only a small trade ship. As it draws closer, it turns out to be an Empire scout broadcasting a false signature! Bastards...you move in to attack

choice.text: Prepare to fight the loyalist ship!
There's no time, get ready to jump.

event.text: You try to block out the horrors of war and focus on your mission.

textList.name: BOSS_SCOUT_RESCUE
textList.text: Shots fly by your port windows followed by an Empire scout in pursuit of a damaged cruiser. Should we move in to engage?
There seems to be a small Pilgrim colony under attack by a loyalist forward scout. Will you protect them?

A number of large transports are being pursued by an Empire bombing squadron. One bomber has managed to slip through the defensive fire, and is poised to wreak havoc among the enormous yet vulnerable transports. There's time for you to advance and take it out!
A battle rages nearby between small fighters; apparently fighting over a space station. The Pilgrims appear to be losing ships fast. Shall we assist them?
A civilian ship is broadcasting a request for assistance on a secure Pilgrim channel. They are being harassed by Empire scouts. Will you respond?

event.text: The people you rescued were primarily refugees fleeing the conflict. They offer you their sincere gratitude.
You are hailed, "Thank you! It's not much but we can repair a bit of damage before you jump off into the war. Good luck!"
The survivors send a message, "Thanks for the support, I don't know how much longer we could have held on. Take some supplies, we probably won't need them at this point."
You receive a message on encrypted Pilgrim channels. It says, "Thanks for helping us, Captain. We're in the process of setting up another emergency repairs station. Transmitting coordinates now."

destroyed.text: With the loyalist ship destroyed you are free to contact their would-be victim.

deadCrew.text: With the UN ship defeated you quickly salvage what you can and move to contact their prey.

textList.name: BOSS_FLEETS_FED
textList.text: You arrive to see a full Pilgrim destroyer squadron, some of them equipped with the newest Sophon technology. This must be a system of high importance to warrant such a fleet.
There are a few Pilgrim fleets in the nearby area as well as a lot of wreckage. There must have been minor skirmishes in the area.
A few scattered heavy vessels are left to defend the nearby Pilgrim settlement. They seem to be in the process of evacuation.
A large host of Pilgrim warships are in formation around the beacon. Sensors run hot with missile locks, but once you transmit your ship signature they leave you alone.
A battalion of Pilgrim fighters are fighting around a nearby moon with their carriers waiting in the distance. They must have encountered an Empire scout squadron.

textList.name: BOSS_FLEETS_BOTH
textList.text: Sensors indicate evidence of a huge battle nearby, but the immediate vicinity seems quiet. You try to lay low and keep out of the fighting.

You arrive to find two fleets crashing against each other. Sensors are tracking the extent of the carnage. You quietly wait for the FTL drive to charge, knowing that the only way you can help is by completing your mission.
A battle rages in the distance. Sensors suggest the presence of many vulnerable escape pods, but you know you cannot stop to help. The mission is paramount.
A battle rages on in the distance. As much as you would like to help in the fight, you know the importance of your mission.
You don't need advanced sensors to tell there is a battle going on. You look out of the window quietly, waiting to jump. There's no way you can help in this fight.
Two fleets are volleying shots at each other. Luckily no one seems interested in your ship. You prepare to make another jump.

textList.name: BOSS_FLEETS_BOTH
textList.text: You arrive in the middle of a raging battle. Both sides are taking heavy losses. A small squadron flies past and an escort craft breaks off, moving toward your position.
Two fleets fight nearby. You try to skirt around the edges of the battle and keep out of weapons range, but a loyalist corvette spots you and moves in.
It's hard to tell who is winning the nearby battle. Before you have a chance to figure it out, a corvette moves in to attack.
The sheer scale of the destruction in the distance is almost breath-taking. Unfortunately, your position as an independent observer doesn't last for long!
The destruction in the distance is almost awe-inspiring. However you're dragged back to reality as sensors indicate you are under attack.
You don't have any time to worry about the battle in the distance. The fight is coming to you really quickly!

textList.name: BOSS_FLEETS_REBEL
textList.text: Although you were expecting the Empire, you didn't expect them to assemble such a large fleet this far into Pilgrim territory. You scanners can hardly register them all before a corvette stationed nearby moves in to attack.
This system is flooded with Empire warships. Luckily your ship's signature is disguised as a civilian transport. Most heavy vessels ignore you but an escort is approaching with weapons hot!
You arrive to find an Empire task force in orbit of a Pilgrim planet, launching landing parties. A picket vessel moves toward your position. Prepare for a fight!
As soon as you arrive you find yourself in the debris of a fierce battle. However, only Empire warships remain and you find yourself immediately under attack.
Shots fly by and your computer registers multiple weapon locks as soon as you arrive. Evasive action!
What was once a great series of space stations is now nothing but a small ring of debris around the nearby moon. There's no time to mourn the dead; an enemy approaches!

The Federation seems to have put up a good fight. A number of loyalist ships lie broken or wounded. However their overwhelming numbers force the remaining Pilgrim forces to retreat. Hopefully you can get away in time as well.

deadCrew.text: There isn't time to salvage the enemy ship but your crew made off with a few nearby materials. Prepare to jump.
